profile_positions.description:
I got to work at Isispace as a (M)-AIV engineer. Throughout the years at Isis I have taken up various roles and tasks. One of which was 6 months as interim Production Planner and Coördinator. I have worked on assembling and testing space sub-systems, building and testing (cube) satellites, assembling launch equipement, writing improvement proposals and procedures, advising engineering departments and more. I have been part of several launch campaigns and solo trips, at SpaceX, Virgin Orbit, Momentus, Exotrail and more. I have been on many testing campaigns, either in-house or at external facilities. 
All and all my tasks vary a lot and I am often asked to jump in where needed, which I like a lot. At this moment my focus is on creating a in-house production line for cube-sat solarpanels.
profile_positions.title: (M)-AIV Engineer

profile_positions.description:
In the managing role I have been able to create and implement new working standards and procedures. With the goal of raising the quality of the designs and to deliver on schedule and budget. This was quite a challenge in a 60 years old company. We had an open way of communicating which I very much appreciated. I was allowed to make mistakes (as long as I learned from them) and to speak my mind. 
As a mechanical engineer I have been able to create a modular system for food processing equipment such as conveyors, metal detectors etc.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Engineer/Manager Engineering

profile_positions.description: At Elten I am hired as a work preperator engineer/controller. Elten is a 40 years old family company which is growing significantly. My main role is to bring the production department to the next level. By implementing regulations, new suppliers, train the workforce, set up documentation and so on. In the 2,5 months that I am working with this company I am getting more and more grip on things. I see changes and there is a noticeable change in the quality of the products and the work environment of the mechanics and electricians.
profile_positions.title: Work preparation engineer/controller

profile_positions.description: In October 2014 I’ve been internally hired as a mechanical engineering drafter at LMCFT (Lockheed Martin Commercial Flight Training, former Sim-Industries). I transferred from the linings department to the hardware engineering team. In this team I have been responsible for the creation and releasing of various drawings, and the execution of ECR’s and ECN’s. Besides that, I also helped out the team wherever they needed and I created meeting minutes of every meeting we attend. I have designed various components and systems for different types of machines. Most recent, I’ve been included into the A350 project, where I’ve had a lot 3d design and investigation work. For this project I was responsible for the design of the roof access and level. Especially the projector setup, frames and cladding was a nice challenge. This enabled me to prove myself to the team and to have a better understanding of the software and the engineering processes in place. After the news of the sale to CAE the whole hardware engineering team was invited to Montreal, Canada to spend 4 weeks in their factory and to learn their methods, procedures and software. This was a very learn full experience for me. The last two years have been a very learn full experience for me and I feel I have grown a lot in this function. I have good results and present myself as a team player who will take the efforts and responsibility’s where needed. As a result of that I have been rewarded with a contract as Mechanical Engineer.
profile_positions.title: Drafter/Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
When I started, the company was very small and I was the 4th person hired in the production team. After a couple of months I started working on the linings for the Boeing 737-800NG. The interior of the cockpit existed out of dozens of vacuum molded ABS parts. These parts had to be cut to size and trimmed nicely, on a high level of quality. Each project took between 850 to 1600 hours to complete  There was no process yet, so I had to create instructions and processes that enabled others to build the simulators. This also meant that I had to design a lot of components which were needed to complete the cockpit structure. The processes and instructions also took a close eye on the quality of the work, something I have always valued as a very high standard and importance. In order to keep that quality high, we’ve often decided with other approaches than usual. A good example of that would be the introduction of upholstered parts, which I made in-house. 
As the company grew we started to build other types of simulators as well. This meant that the workforce grew and I started to work with a team to build the interiors. The team (that at the highest point existed out of 7 people) had to be learned how we build our simulators and to what quality we do that. Another result of the growth was that I had to keep track, create and report the planning of our builds, prepare the parts for installation, to have contact with suppliers and so on. I was faced with a lot of challenges thru out the years, for example the interior for a fixed base Airbus A320. Since original part weren’t available I had to design and manufacture the interior from sheets of plastic. At the same time I also needed to keep an eye on the progress of the other projects. Also the resent Boeing 767 full flight and fixed base has a lot of linings designed by me, I had to work with pixelated pictures that were made in America to create the custom cockpit interior, a one off for our customer FedEx.
profile_positions.title: Various

profile_positions.description:
At this company I was placed in various other company’s for a temporary employment. During my employment I went to an evening school where I was learning for aircraft technician Cat. B1.1. After 6 months of 2 nights a week school we found out that the school didn’t had the proper certification to legally provide us with education. Therefore I never got the certifications. 
•	Burhs, Zaandam. I build different types of sorting machines for the posting industry. 
•	For the same company I was send to Sydney Australia for a 4 weeks during modification of one of the machines, which were part of a packing line. 
•	Nedtrain, Leidschendam. Where I worked at the undercarriage department and was responsible for the maintenance and refurbishing of various train undercarriages and other tasks.
profile_positions.title: Mechanic

profile_positions.description: At toyota Compier is was hired as a junior car mechanic. I performed maintenance and small repairs on automobiles.
profile_positions.title: Junior Car Mechanic
